channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

item.title: Hidden Brain: How Cigarette Taxes Affect Food Buying
item.description: July 25, 2017 - A new study shows a connection between cigarette taxes and food stamps. When cigarette taxes go up, smokers end up spending more of their income on cigarettes and that leaves less money for food.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - A new study shows a connection between cigarette taxes and food stamps. When cigarette taxes go up, smokers end up spending more of their income on cigarettes and that leaves less money for food. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/25/539183590/hidden-brain-cigarette-taxes

item.title: What Are The Planet's Real 'Talking' Chimps And Gorillas Saying?
item.description: July 25, 2017 - Movies are full of loquacious chimps, but could nonhuman apes really use language? NPR's Skunk Bear sorts through the disturbing history of research on ape language to sort fact from wishful thinking.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - Movies are full of loquacious chimps, but could nonhuman apes really use language? NPR's Skunk Bear sorts through the disturbing history of research on ape language to sort fact from wishful thinking. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/25/538580495/what-are-the-planet-s-real-talking-chimps-and-gorillas-saying

item.title: Alabama Woman Stuck In NYC Traffic In 1902 Invented The Windshield Wiper
item.description: July 25, 2017 - Entrepreneur Mary Anderson thought it made no sense that New York streetcar drivers had to keep jumping off to clean snow from the windshield. She soon won a patent for her "window cleaning device."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - Entrepreneur Mary Anderson thought it made no sense that New York streetcar drivers had to keep jumping off to clean snow from the windshield. She soon won a patent for her "window cleaning device." http://www.npr.org/2017/07/25/536835744/alabama-woman-stuck-in-nyc-traffic-in-1902-invented-the-windshield-wiper

item.title: A New Study Shows The Moon's Interior Could Contain Water
item.description: July 24, 2017 - Sick of your crowded neighborhood pool? A new study shows there might be quite a bit of water on a more isolated place — the moon.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - Sick of your crowded neighborhood pool? A new study shows there might be quite a bit of water on a more isolated place — the moon. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/24/539066277/a-new-study-shows-the-moons-interior-could-contain-water

item.title: Inside The Global Seed Vault, Where The History And Future Of Agriculture Is Stored
item.description: July 24, 2017 - Seeds on Ice author Cary Fowler describes the underground tunnel near the North Pole, which stores and protects a collection of 933,000 samples of different, unique crop varieties.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - Seeds on Ice author Cary Fowler describes the underground tunnel near the North Pole, which stores and protects a collection of 933,000 samples of different, unique crop varieties. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/24/539005688/inside-the-global-seed-vault-where-the-history-and-future-of-agriculture-is-stor

item.title: Female Athletes Are Closing The Gender Gap When It Comes To Concussions
item.description: July 24, 2017 - Gina "Danger" Mazany is a professional mixed martial arts athlete, and she's helping researchers learn more about head injuries and the female brain.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - Gina "Danger" Mazany is a professional mixed martial arts athlete, and she's helping researchers learn more about head injuries and the female brain. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/24/538294331/female-athletes-are-closing-the-gender-gap-when-it-comes-to-concussions

item.title: Despite Climate Change Setbacks, Al Gore 'Comes Down On The Side Of Hope'
item.description: July 24, 2017 - Even though President Trump promised to pull the U.S. from the Paris climate accord, Al Gore still sees an "excellent chance" of meeting the accord's commitments to reduce global warming.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - Even though President Trump promised to pull the U.S. from the Paris climate accord, Al Gore still sees an "excellent chance" of meeting the accord's commitments to reduce global warming. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/24/538391386/despite-climate-change-setbacks-al-gore-comes-down-on-the-side-of-hope

item.title: Researchers Map More Of The Ocean Floor In Search For Missing Plane
item.description: July 23, 2017 - The search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 did not turn up a plane, but it did uncover a detailed view of the ocean floor — volcanoes, shipwrecks, and mountains to rival Mount Everest.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 23, 2017 - The search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 did not turn up a plane, but it did uncover a detailed view of the ocean floor — volcanoes, shipwrecks, and mountains to rival Mount Everest. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/23/538825548/researchers-map-more-of-the-ocean-floor-in-search-for-missing-plane

item.title: As The Climate Changes, Kenyan Herders Find Centuries-Old Way Of Life In Danger
item.description: July 23, 2017 - Nomadic herders in Kenya's northwest are having to move farther afield as sustained drought fundamentally changes the landscape. The result: no grasses for their herds.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 23, 2017 - Nomadic herders in Kenya's northwest are having to move farther afield as sustained drought fundamentally changes the landscape. The result: no grasses for their herds. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/07/23/538373985/as-the-climate-changes-kenyan-herders-find-centuries-old-way-of-life-in-danger

item.title: Beyond The Nasty Needle: Trying To Make Vaccines More Comfy And Convenient
item.description: July 23, 2017 - From tiny, dissolving needles to high-powered liquid streams and nasal sprays, scientists are developing alternatives to typical vaccinations.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 23, 2017 - From tiny, dissolving needles to high-powered liquid streams and nasal sprays, scientists are developing alternatives to typical vaccinations. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/23/537287781/beyond-the-nasty-needle-trying-to-make-vaccines-more-comfy-and-convenient

item.title: A Bother, A Brotherhood: Living Among The Mines In Coal Country
item.description: July 22, 2017 - When Mary Jo and Mike Picklo bought their house in 2003, they expected to retire in it — until a coal mine opened across the street. They don't want it there, but they are nearly alone in their view.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 22, 2017 - When Mary Jo and Mike Picklo bought their house in 2003, they expected to retire in it — until a coal mine opened across the street. They don't want it there, but they are nearly alone in their view. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/22/536809177/a-bother-a-brotherhood-living-among-the-mines-in-coal-country

item.title: A Wake-Up Call: Coffee Recalled By FDA For Having Viagra-Like Ingredient
item.description: July 21, 2017 - Regulators took issue with the tortuously named "New of Kopi Jantan Tradisional Natural Herbs Coffee," which didn't declare a chemical akin to the erectile dysfunction drug's active ingredient.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 21, 2017 - Regulators took issue with the tortuously named "New of Kopi Jantan Tradisional Natural Herbs Coffee," which didn't declare a chemical akin to the erectile dysfunction drug's active ingredient. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/21/538512368/a-wake-up-call-coffee-recalled-by-fda-for-having-viagra-like-ingredient

item.title: To Shrink Mosquito Population, Scientists Are Releasing 20 Million Mosquitoes
item.description: July 21, 2017 - Scientists plan to release millions of sterile, male bacteria-infected mosquitoes in California, to breed with wild females. They're hoping for a "steep decline" in the species that carries Zika.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 21, 2017 - Scientists plan to release millions of sterile, male bacteria-infected mosquitoes in California, to breed with wild females. They're hoping for a "steep decline" in the species that carries Zika. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/21/538470321/to-shrink-the-mosquito-population-scientists-are-releasing-20-million-of-them

item.title: Is It A Good Idea To Pay Villagers Not To Chop Down Trees?
item.description: July 20, 2017 - Governments dole out millions each year. Researchers debate whether the payouts actually work. A new study from Uganda offers some answers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - Governments dole out millions each year. Researchers debate whether the payouts actually work. A new study from Uganda offers some answers. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/20/538115612/is-it-a-good-idea-to-pay-villagers-not-to-chop-down-trees

item.title: GOP Effort To Make Environmental Science 'Transparent' Worries Scientists
item.description: July 20, 2017 - There's a push in Congress to rewrite how science gets used in regulation — and that has researchers worried. The industry-backed bill would let business nitpick raw data and ignore valid results.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - There's a push in Congress to rewrite how science gets used in regulation — and that has researchers worried. The industry-backed bill would let business nitpick raw data and ignore valid results. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/20/537243392/gop-effort-to-make-environmental-science-transparent-worries-scientists
